instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no red light
threads.message:
I have a Air 13 inch with no red light on the charger, only green. I know it means it has no feedback from Sys Onewire, but how do I go about to test it on an Air? I know how it works on a pro. Got some values:

PPBUS_G3H at F7140 - 8.17v
PP3V42_G3H at C5120 = 3.42v
PP3V42_G3H at BC_ACOK Pin 14 U7100 = 3.39v
CHGR_ACIN Pin 3 U7100 = 5.27v

How should i trouble shoot this?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no red light
threads.message: PPBUS is a bit low, seems SMC is not working properly, check sense resistors on ISL if everything is ok my next guess is SMC.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no red light
threads.message: PPBUS is too low so SMC is not running. SMC_RESET high? Corrosion under/around SMC?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no red light
threads.message: There was indeed some corrosion, we have replaced C5008 it looked like one drop on that IC but indeed might have leaked under the SMC, SMC_RESET_L = 3.417v and R7100 = 0 ohm

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no red light
threads.message: Update: after an SMC reflow we got an orange light but next missing PP5V_S4RS3 but we do have 3.3v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no red light
threads.message: The usual, check for a pulse after connecting power on PP5V_S4RS3. Is it power cycling? Check resistors/traces around U6100, could still be more crap under SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no red light
threads.message: Are you getting PM_DSW_PWRGD after the smc reflow?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no red light
threads.message: Replaced the SMC completely and now it works thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no red light
threads.message: In answer to lewis, no but after replace it yes
